text: Csobád is a village in Encs District of Borsod-Abaúj-Zemplén County. Its population in 2024 was 693. == Location == It is located about 25 km northeast of Miskolc, about halfway between Szikszó and Encs. == History == The name Csobád first appeared in 1323 as Chabad. In 1329 the village already had a church. == Politics == === Mayors === * 1990–1994: Béla Szobota (Christian Democratic People's Party) * 1994–1998: István Bukovenszki (independent) * 1998–2002: István Bukovenszki (independent) * 2002–2006: István Bukovenszki (independent) * 2006–2010: István Bukovenszki (independent) * 2010–2014: István Bukovenszki (independent) * 2014–2019: József Hudopkó (Fidesz-KDNP) * 2019–2024: József Hudopkó (Fidesz-KDNP) * 2024– : József Hudopkó (Fidesz- KDNP) == Population == In 2022, 84.9% of the population identified as Hungarian, 16.1% as Gypsy, 0.5% as Armenian, 0.3% as Rusyn, 0.3% as German, 0.2% as Greek, 0.2% as Romanian, 0.2% as Ukrainian, 1.4% as other non- nationality (14.8% did not declare; due to dual identities, the total may be higher than 100%). By religion, 34.3% were Roman Catholic, 9.5% Reformed, 11% Greek Catholic, 0.2% other Christian, 0.2% Israelite, 8% non-denominational (36.7% did not respond).Csobád Helységnévtár == Notes == Category:Settlements in Borsod-Abaúj-Zemplén County Category:Villages in Hungary Category:Encs District
title: Csobád
